body_html:
as of today,(17th January 2017) this issue is still not resolved.

I had it three days ago on my Windows 10 laptop and now I'm running into it again on a AWS EC2 instance.

Several times I've tried starting over with

conda create -n venv35 numpy python=3.5

followed by

source activate venv35
pip install --ignore-installed --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-0.12.1-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl

I've tried uninstalling/installing protobuf, but since I still get the same behaviour even if protobuf is not even installed, I don't believe that is has something to do with it.

This is very frustrating. Any help is appreciated.

body:
as of today,(17th January 2017) this issue is still not resolved.

I had it three days ago on my Windows 10 laptop and now I'm running into it again on a AWS EC2 instance.

Several times I've tried starting over with
```bash
conda create -n venv35 numpy python=3.5
```
followed by
```bash
source activate venv35
pip install --ignore-installed --upgrade https://storage.googleapis.com/tensorflow/linux/gpu/tensorflow_gpu-0.12.1-cp35-cp35m-linux_x86_64.whl
```
I've tried uninstalling/installing protobuf, but since I still get the same behaviour even if protobuf is not even installed, I don't believe that is has something to do with it.

This is very frustrating. Any help is appreciated.
